item.title: Samsung S20 using ShortCut Master Lite app for band selections and associated PSC / PCI
item.author: invalid@example.com (zillah)
item.dc:creator: zillah
item.content:encoded:
Dear folk

At work we used to have S7 per-installed from my friend to do test using PCI (for 4G Physical Cell ID) / PSC (for 3G Primary Scrambling Code) and Band as per attached photos

Recently I have got Samsung S20 FE 5G un-rooted looking to use the same app Shortcut Master Lite it to do the same thing as on S7

Can you please help me how to get to the same options attached (those are on S7)

Code: 
https://imgur.com/a/L5Lnp1V
Thx

item.title: Be Careful !!! When you see this !!!
item.author: invalid@example.com (asssh)
item.dc:creator: asssh
item.content:encoded:
It is about some android glitch recently found.....
The main conflict is about a picture
(link of that picture is:
[HIDEREACT=1]
https://drive.google.com/file/d/11rxzYvPcIOh_8GvS4XSC3YtbW3CecE-O/view
[/HIDEREACT] )
If you see this picture anyhow, don't set the picture as wallpaper in your android mobile.
This will soft brick your phone.
And for Samsung phone, never do this(may be affected for other brand also).

You hear it all the time, the latest gadgets are released to the general public and millions line up to get a new one. What happened to the last phone that was great, though? Think about it for a moment, the average contract that you have to sign to take advantage of the smartphones make you stick with an option for 2 years. That means that the phone that you get has to last you a couple of years, and the truth of the matter is that the average lifespan of these gadgets is less than that...

item.title: Android O Vs iOS 11: Which Is Gonna Win the Battle?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Boo)
item.dc:creator: Boo
item.content:encoded:
Hello Guys,.

Today, let's debate on iOS 11 vs. Android O: Which is going to win the battle?



Apple just walked us through iOS 11 for the iPhone, and a few weeks ago Google introduced us to Android O. Combined, this software will power practically every phone in the world. Google's Android O already has a public beta out, while, Apple's iOS 11 just got its first developer preview up and running...

Android O Vs iOS 11: Which Is Gonna Win the Battle?
